title: Female flyer bombarded by in-air sexually inappropriate messages from rugby lads
text:

A Virgin Atlantic passenger was bombarded with sexually inappropriate chat messages on her flight, including one from a user called 'big d**k swinger'.

Jessica Van Meir, from Atlanta, Georgia, US, was sickened by the behaviour of a drunk rugby group on the in-flight chat system.

One of them told her '55c you tidy babe', while another passenger posted two winking emojis under the username 'big d**k swinger'.

Ms Meir, a Cambridge University graduate who works in the UK, called the individuals out for sexual harassment and told them she would be taking it up with Virgin.

(Image: Jessica Van Meir)

(Image: Jessica Van Meir)

The legal analyst shared images of the chat messages on Twitter , writing: "Yesterday I was on a @VirginAtlantic flight, and I unexpectedly received these sexually harassing messages on my screen (I was in 55C).

"The flight attendants were helpful and dealt with it swiftly. Have any other women had this happen to them? #metoo #cyberharassment @SCFGallagher .

"After the flight attendants spoke with the guys, I walked through the aisle and took a picture of them. Afterwards, a young guy came up to me and said he heard about the chat between me and the guys and wanted to apologize on their behalf.

"They were on a rugby trip and he was one of the leaders. He said the guys had been drinking and he’d talk to them, was sorry and hoped we could leave it at that.

(Image: Jessica Van Meir)

"What matters to me is not going after these guys, but making sure they understand why it was harmful."

Virgin Atlantic apologised to Ms Meir and said it was reviewing its systems to prevent a repeat incident.

A spokesman tweeted: "Whilst we are not always responsible for the actions of our passengers, we do not deem this behavior acceptable."
description: Jessica Van Meir, from Atlanta, Georgia, US, received inappropriate messages from a drunk rugby group on a Virgin Atlantic flight
